required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fragmin In The Treatment Of Acute Deep-Vein Thrombosis With Or Without Pulmonary Embolism In Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Fragmin Safety And Efficacy In The Treatment Of Acute Deep-Vein Thrombosis With Or Without Pulmonary Embolism And Extended Thromboprophylaxis In Cancer Patients In Slovakia (An Open, Prospective, Non-Comparative Study)

brief_summary.textblock: To collect postmarketing data about Fragmin safety and efficacy in the treatment of deep vein thrombosis with or without pulmonary embolism in cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Method: consecutive patient sampling. Patients were (are) included in the study in consecutive manner if they fulfilled the inclusion criteria and any of the exclusion criteria were not present.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Resolution of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) of the Leg
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 6 or End of Treatment (EOT) (up to Month 6)
primary_outcome.description: Resolution criteria: clinical cure, defined as negative results of a compressive ultrasound examination of the leg

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Severe Bleeding That Resulted in a Transfusion of at Least 2 Units of Blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Month 6 or EOT (up to Month 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Episodes of the severe bleeding (intracranial, intraspinal, intraocular, retroperitoneal, or in pericardial area) or bleeding from gastrointestinal (GIT), urinary system or gynecological bleeding resulted in a need for a transfusion of at least 2 units of blood. Subjects were assessed for severe bleeding as part of a systematic adverse event assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Severe Bleeding That Resulted in a Decrease in Hemoglobin Level of at Least 2.0 Grams Per Deciliter (g/dL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Month 6 or EOT (up to Month 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Episodes of the severe bleeding (intracranial, intraspinal, intraocular, retroperitoneal, or in pericardial area) or bleeding from GIT, urinary system or gynecological bleeding which led to a drop of hemoglobin of at least 2.0 g/dL. Subjects were assessed for severe bleeding as part of a systematic adverse event assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With and Without Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 2, Month 1, Month 3, and Month 6 or EOT (up to Month 6)
secondary_outcome.description: PE (diagnosed on the basis of ventilation-perfusion scan of the lungs or autopsy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Recurrent DVT
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the number of participants with recurrence of DVT (diagnosed using compressive ultrasound examination or autopsy) after it has resolved (at the same location) or occurrence of new DVT at a new location on any of the post-baseline visits

arm_group.arm_group_label: One cohort of patients treated with dalteparin.
arm_group.description: About 100 patients with deep-vein thrombosis and with or without pulmonary embolism will be included in the study.

intervention.description: Month 1: dalteparin 200 IU/kg SC once daily. Months 2-6: dalteparin 150 IU/kg SC, once daily.
intervention.arm_group_label: One cohort of patients treated with dalteparin.

study_pop.textblock: The patients are identified in primary care setting.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patient of 18 - 70 years of age.
- Cancer patient with proven deep-vein thrombosis with or without pulmonary embolism confirmed by combination of clinical signs and symptoms, pulmonary hypertension on echocardiogram, X-ray examination of the lung and eventually perfusion/ventilation scan of the lung.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bleeding
- Hypersensitivity to FRAGMINÂ® or other low-molecular weight heparins.
- Serum creatinine level > 150 umol/l.
- Platelet count of less than 100 000 per cubic millimeter at the beginning of the therapy.
- Patient on oral anticoagulation therapy in the last 7 days.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 200 International Units per kilogram (IU/kg) total body weight subcutaneously (SC) once daily (QD) for Month 1, then 150 IU/kg total body weight SC QD from Months 2 to 6.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 200 IU/kg total body weight SC QD for Month 1, then 150 IU/kg total body weight SC QD from Months 2 to 6.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Resolution of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) of the Leg
outcome.description: Resolution criteria: clinical cure, defined as negative results of a compressive ultrasound examination of the leg
outcome.time_frame: Month 6 or End of Treatment (EOT) (up to Month 6)
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study treatment and who had at least 1 post baseline efficacy measurement.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 200 IU/kg total body weight SC QD for Month 1, then 150 IU/kg total body weight SC QD from Months 2 to 6.

measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study treatment and who had at least 1 post baseline efficacy measurement.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Severe Bleeding That Resulted in a Transfusion of at Least 2 Units of Blood
outcome.description: Episodes of the severe bleeding (intracranial, intraspinal, intraocular, retroperitoneal, or in pericardial area) or bleeding from gastrointestinal (GIT), urinary system or gynecological bleeding resulted in a need for a transfusion of at least 2 units of blood. Subjects were assessed for severe bleeding as part of a systematic adverse event assessment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Month 6 or EOT (up to Month 6)
outcome.population: The safety analysis set was defined as all participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
